articles.headline: Jeb Bush, 20 Years After Conversion, Is Guided by His Catholic Faith
articles.snippet: Mr. Bush’s Catholicism, which he turned to after a campaign that strained his marriage, has become a central element of the way he shapes his life and frames his views on public policy.
articles.abstract: Mr. Bush’s Catholicism, which he turned to after a campaign that strained his marriage, has become a central element of the way he shapes his life and frames his views on public policy.
articles.lead_paragraph: CORAL GABLES, Fla. — He arrived a few minutes early — no entourage, just his wife and daughter — and, sweating through a polo shirt in the hot morning sun, settled quietly into the 14th row at the Church of the Little Flower.

articles.headline: Deep Wounds and Lingering Questions After Israel’s Bitter Race
articles.snippet: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu retained power, but his sharp-edged campaign raised questions about Israel’s future.
articles.abstract: Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu retained power, but his sharp-edged campaign raised questions about Israel’s future.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Benjamin Netanyahu was poised to return to power. But there was a cloud over his apparent turnaround, the result of an increasingly shrill campaign that raised questions about his ability to heal Israel’s internal wounds or better its standing in the world.

articles.headline: Facebook Announces a Payments Feature for Its Messenger App
articles.snippet: The feature will at first be limited to people who are Facebook friends, but Wall Street expects that such transactions will become a big business.
articles.abstract: The feature will at first be limited to people who are Facebook friends, but Wall Street expects that such transactions will become a big business.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Facebook‘s instant messaging service isn’t just for sending smiley faces and photos anymore. Now you can use it to send money instantly to your friends.

articles.headline: Netanyahu Soundly Defeats Chief Rival in Israeli Elections
articles.snippet: After a bruising campaign focused on his failings, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seemed all but certain to form a new government, though he offended many in the process.
articles.abstract: After a bruising campaign focused on his failings, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu seemed all but certain to form a new government, though he offended many in the process.
articles.lead_paragraph: TEL AVIV — After a bruising campaign focused on his failings, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel won a clear victory in Tuesday’s elections and seemed all but certain to form a new government and serve a fourth term, though he offended many voters and alienated allies in the process.

articles.headline: Taxes Take Away, but Also Give Back, Mostly to the Very Rich
articles.snippet: Of the $540 billion in tax subsidies for housing, education, retirement and savings in 2013, the top 1 percent received more than the money received by the bottom 80 percent combined.
articles.abstract: Of the $540 billion in tax subsidies for housing, education, retirement and savings in 2013, the top 1 percent received more than the money received by the bottom 80 percent combined.
articles.lead_paragraph: “Get your billions back, America,” the tax preparer H&R Block urges in television advertisements.

articles.headline: Patching Up the Social Safety Net
articles.snippet: Universal programs financed by broader taxes could appear unfair, but targeted social insurance financed by progressive taxes is likely to be stingy and politically weak.
articles.abstract: Universal programs financed by broader taxes could appear unfair, but targeted social insurance financed by progressive taxes is likely to be stingy and politically weak.
articles.lead_paragraph: Few people played as critical a role in the construction of the American social safety net as Wilbur Cohen.

articles.headline: Cleveland Clinic Grapples With Changes in Health Care
articles.snippet: To keep pace with insurers’ expectations, the renowned health system is trying to become as good at primary care as it is at performing complicated procedures.
articles.abstract: To keep pace with insurers’ expectations, the renowned health system is trying to become as good at primary care as it is at performing complicated procedures.
articles.lead_paragraph: CLEVELAND — In downtrodden East Cleveland, a three-story family health center has replaced the city’s full-service hospital. Seven thousand miles away in Abu Dhabi, a gleaming 24-story hospital is preparing to admit patients this year.

articles.headline: New Bribery Evidence Adds a Year to Biomet’s Probation
articles.snippet: The Justice Department is examining new evidence to find out if the medical devices manufacturer helped bribe government officials in Mexico and Brazil.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department is examining new evidence to find out if the medical devices manufacturer helped bribe government officials in Mexico and Brazil.
articles.lead_paragraph: Life was supposed to return to normal for Biomet, the giant medical devices manufacturer accused of foreign bribery, when its federal probation expired next week. But on Tuesday, Biomet disclosed that prosecutors would extend its probation another year as they investigate new evidence of wrongdoing at the company, the Justice Department’s latest attempt to stem a widening pattern of corporate recidivism.

articles.headline: Demise of Gigaom Doesn’t Faze Its Rivals
articles.snippet: When the technology news site ceased publishing, it seemed like a cautionary tale for a new gilded age, but insiders say it faced its own special problems.
articles.abstract: When the technology news site ceased publishing, it seemed like a cautionary tale for a new gilded age, but insiders say it faced its own special problems.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the week and a half since the technology news site Gigaom stopped publishing, it has been held up as a cautionary tale for media in a go-go era. Here was a news organization that once looked promising, but collapsed so unexpectedly that its reporters were working on articles right up to the moment they were told they were out of jobs.

articles.headline: Win in Israel Sets Netanyahu on Path to Rebuild and Redefine Government
articles.snippet: Israelis paved the way for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to lead a right-leaning and religious coalition that could be easier to control.
articles.abstract: Israelis paved the way for Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu to lead a right-leaning and religious coalition that could be easier to control.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Israelis emboldened Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu with a clear mandate in balloting on Tuesday, paving the way for him to lead a right-leaning and religious coalition that could be far easier to control, since his own party holds many more seats now.

articles.headline: Obama May Find It Impossible to Mend Frayed Ties to Netanyahu
articles.snippet: Benjamin Netanyahu’s victory appears to have dashed any hopes President Obama might have had for a way out of his tumultuous and often bitter relationship with the leader.
articles.abstract: Benjamin Netanyahu’s victory appears to have dashed any hopes President Obama might have had for a way out of his tumultuous and often bitter relationship with the leader.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Obama and Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel had a poisonous relationship long before Mr. Netanyahu swept to victory on Tuesday night in elections watched minute-by-minute at the White House.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Michael D. Shear

articles.headline: Tunisia Museum Attack Is Blow to Nation’s Democratic Shift
articles.snippet: Gunmen killed 19 people in downtown Tunis, which dealt a new blow to a tourist industry that is vital to Tunisia as it struggles to consolidate its transition to democracy.
articles.abstract: Gunmen killed 19 people in downtown Tunis, which dealt a new blow to a tourist industry that is vital to Tunisia as it struggles to consolidate its transition to democracy.
articles.lead_paragraph: CAIRO — Gunmen in military uniforms killed 19 people on Wednesday in a midday attack on a museum in downtown Tunis, dealing a new blow to the tourist industry that is vital to Tunisia as it struggles to consolidate the only transition to democracy after the Arab Spring revolts.

articles.headline: Sony’s PlayStation Vue Is Introduced in 3 Cities
articles.snippet: The web-based service, targeted at gamers, is initially available to PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4 owners in New York, Chicago and Philadelphia.
articles.abstract: The web-based service, targeted at gamers, is initially available to PlayStation 3 and PlayStation 4 owners in New York, Chicago and Philadelphia.
articles.lead_paragraph: Television fans who want to break free from a traditional TV subscription now have more options than ever to pay for what they want to watch, and how they want to watch it.
